fields.headline: New Media Age
fields.bodyText: British newspapers have started embracing paid-for content as the two biggest circulating broadsheets both confirmed plans to charge online consumers this week. Channel 4 and Granada are among a number of media giants taking part in trials for a new iTV advertising initiative that could spell the end of interoperability problems across digital platforms. The Spice Girls' and Atomic Kitten's record label, Virgin Records is set to be the first to launch an unmetered ISP for its artists in the UK. The UK is in danger of falling behind in the European e-commerce market following its failure to meet today's deadline for compliance with the EU's electronic signatures directive. The UK email marketing industry remains split over the opt-in or opt-out debate despite a preliminary European Union committee vote last week supporting the latter. Online travel specialist Expedia is to license part of the technology that powers its site for use by 21,000 offline and online travel agencies.
